title: Mohinga (Burmese Fish Noodle Soup)
steps: Toast rice at 350°F (175°C) for 20 minutes until golden. Grind to powder.
Boil water with lemongrass, ginger piece, bay leaves, black pepper, white pepper, and salt for 15 minutes.
Add catfish and simmer 15 minutes. Turn fish and simmer 5 more minutes until flesh separates from bone.
Remove fish, cool, discard skin, separate meat from bones. Return skeleton to pot.
Simmer skeleton 15 minutes. Strain broth (should yield about 10 cups).
Whisk rice powder with a bit of broth, then stir into pot. Simmer 5 minutes until slightly thickened.
Heat oil in pan. Stir-fry lemongrass stalk (minced), minced garlic, and minced ginger for 1 minute.
Add fish meat with paprika and turmeric. Mash into paste and cook 1 minute.
Pour fish mixture into broth. Add onions and fish sauce. Simmer 5 minutes. Adjust seasoning.
Cook noodles 5-6 minutes. Drain and rinse.
Divide noodles among bowls. Ladle soup over top.
Serve with halved hard-boiled eggs, crackers, cilantro, and lime.
notes: Volume conversions: ½ cup rice ≈ 95g, 3 quarts water ≈ 2840g, 3 stalks lemongrass ≈ 45g, 2 oz ginger ≈ 57g, 1½ tsp black pepper ≈ 4g, ½ tsp white pepper ≈ 2g, 2 tsp salt ≈ 10g, ⅓ cup oil ≈ 79g, ¼ cup garlic ≈ 40g, 3 tbsp ginger ≈ 45g
The trick is achieving the right balance of ingredients - fresh fish and lemongrass counteract fishy aroma
